article.description: Zavier Peart scored 16 points and Zane Waterman and Aaron Walker Jr. each added 15 points to lift Manhattan to an 80-68 win over Hofstra Friday night.
article.headline: Manhattan dumps Hofstra 80-68 behind Peart
article.story: RIVERDALE, N.Y. -- Zavier Peart scored 16 points and Zane Waterman and Aaron Walker Jr. each added 15 points to lift Manhattan to an 80-68 win over Hofstra Friday night. The Jaspers led 41-34 at halftime and a 10-5 run stretched the lead to 51-39 after Ak Ojo's dunk with 15:42 remaining. Over the next nine minutes the Pride outscored Manhattan 21-15 and cut the deficit to 66-60 on a jumper by Justin Wright-Foreman with 6:49 to play but couldn't get closer. Off the bench, Wright-Foreman led Hofstra with 17 points shooting 7 for 14 from the floor. Manhattan had a 35-25 edge on the boards and made all 17 of its free throws. The Jaspers got their first win of the season after opening the season with two defeats. The Jaspers pushed their all-time record against Hofstra (1-2) to 41-22.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
